message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.SD 

This paper is about dialogue generation, which is a subfield of natural language processing (NLP) and falls under the category of Computational Linguistics (cs.CL). The paper proposes an approach that involves training a neural network-based conversational agent to alternate between data distillation and model training to control the specificity of its responses. This approach involves reinforcement learning, which is a subfield of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also discusses the use of multiple subsystems to tailor the output to different input contexts, which involves machine learning (cs.LG) and neural networks (cs.NE). Finally, the paper discusses the evaluation of the proposed approach, which involves statistical methods (cs.SD).
